title: As a Partner League Admin, I want Clubs notified if a subsequent PL request is entered for a player
custom_preconds:
Related to [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1955|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1955|smart-link] 

AC:

* If a Club attempts to enter a partner league request for a player that already has an Approved request, the system will generate a notification Email
* Users from the following Orgs, set up to receive Partner League emails, will receive the emails:
** BOC
** ML Org with the in process (Approved) request
** Partner League President for the league the player is playing in
* The email will read as follows:
** Subject: Partner League Request will Expire in 48 Hours 
** Body: Please be advised that another Club has entered a Partner League request for {Player Name}.  Your  request will now expire on [request expiration date] at [request expiration time].

If you do not create a contract in EBIS prior to expiration, the other Clubâ€™s request will be approved.  Please contact the BOC with any questions.

title: As a BOC Admin, I want PL Request Status to be Signed After a contract is submitted
custom_preconds:
AC:

* When a Minor Contract associated with a Partner League request reaches Submitted state, the status of the Partner League request will update to â€˜Signedâ€™

title: As a Partner League Admin, I want Approved Requests to Expire
custom_preconds:
AC:

* If an Approved request reaches itâ€™s Expiration date, and not contract has been created from the request, itâ€™s status will change to Expired
** This includes initial requests that have pending requests waiting for their expiration

title: As a Partner League Admin, I want the Request Approvals Email Updated
custom_preconds:
Related to: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1065|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1065|smart-link] 

AC:

* The email that is sent when a partner league request is approved will be update to the following:
** Subject: Partner League Request Has Been Approved
** Body:  The Partner League Request submitted by [MJ Submitting Org] on [submission date of request] for [Player Roster First, Last] of the [Partner League Club Name] has been approved.
In the event another Club submits a Partner League request on this player, you will receive an updated notification indicating the start of a 48-hour period to complete the signing of the player
* If there is a subsequent club or club(s) with pending requests, a modified email will be sent:
** Subject: Partner League Request Has Been Approved
** Body:  The Partner League Request submitted by [MJ Submitting Org] on [submission date of request] for [Player Roster First, Last] of the [Partner League Club Name] has been approved.
Please note, another Club has submitted a Partner League request on this player. Your request will expire in 48-hours, on [request expiration date] at [request expiration time].
If you do not create a contract in EBIS prior to expiration, the other Clubâ€™s request will be approved. Please contact the BOC with any questions.

title: As a Partner League Admin, I want Clubs to be stopped from creating requests for a player that has a submitted request
custom_preconds:
Related to: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1053|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1053|smart-link] 

Context: Clubs are currently able to submit a Partner League Request prior when there is another request in submitted state because the expiration date does not get set until the request is approved

AC:

* When a Club User clicks Submit Request, the system will perform a check to see if the selected player has a request in submitted state
* If the player has a request that is in submitted state, the system will return the following error:
** Title: Error
** Body: There is already a pending request for this player.  Please contact the BOC.
** Buttons: Close

title: As a Partner League Admin, I want Pending requests to be auto approved when the initial request expires
custom_preconds:
AC:

* When an initial partner league request expires, the next Pending request (in order of creation) will be auto approved
* The Approval notification emails will be sent out to all appropriate recipients
** BOC PL Admin
** Request ML Club
** League President from League player is playing in
** Covered in: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1975|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1975|smart-link]

title: As a BOC Admin, I want the Partner League Request Process Overhauled
custom_preconds:
AC:

* If there are no active PL Requests entered for a player, the first Club to enter a request will get 5 days (120 hours) from their submission of the request
** Emails will need to be updated: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1065|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1065|smart-link] 
** The request will expire at the end of the 5 days
* If another Club attempts to submit a request during the 5 days, they will be blocked per [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1934|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1934|smart-link] 
** BOC will be notified via email ([https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1976|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1976|smart-link] )
** Initial club will be notified via email that they now have 48 hours ([https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1976|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1976|smart-link] )

title: As a Club Admin User, I want to be able to edit a PL Player's EBIS Profile upon getting an Approved Request
custom_preconds:
Context: Currently, for players who have never signed a contract in EBIS, their SSN is missing in their profile. When a team tries to sign the player from a Partner League, they canâ€™t formally submit the contract bc of the missing information. Typically, clubs can only edit player profiles that they have directly drafted or signed in EBIS.

AC:

* Add an â€œEditâ€� button on relevant Partner Player Profiles for Club Admins upon receiving an:
** Approved Partner League Request on the Partner League Requests widget in EBIS

title: As a Partner League Admin, I want a more detailed warning when a Club enters a subsequent request is entered
custom_preconds:
Related to: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1934|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1934|smart-link] 

AC:

* When a Club User clicks Submit Request, the system will perform a check to see if the selected player has a request in submitted state
* If the player has a request that is in flight (Approved), the system will return the following warning:
** Title: Error
** Body: There is already a pending request for this player.Â  The Club will have 48 hours to agree to terms with the player.Â  In the event they do not agree, you will be notified via email that your request has been approved.  Until that time, please do not contact the player or the player's Club.

Please contact the BOC with any questions."
** Buttons: Continue, Cancel
* If the user chooses to continue, a Pending request will be created

title: As a Partner League Admin, I want a new "Denied" Status
custom_preconds:
AC:

* When a Partner League Admin goes to the Requests tab on the portal to view Requests, there will be a new â€œDenyâ€� option to select
* Selecting this button will get rid of the approval option, and update the Request status to â€œDeniedâ€�
* Selecting this button will result in no changes made to any roster

title: As a Partner League Club Admin, I want to be able to Trade Players in the Portal
custom_preconds:
AC:

* After navigating to a Playerâ€™s profile on the Partner League Portal, there should be a â€œTransfer Playerâ€� button at the top of the screen, next to the playerâ€™s nameÂ 
* Selecting this button should bring up a â€œTransfer Playerâ€� modal
* On the modal, will be a table with the following columns:
** Player
*** This will be auto-populated with the Playerâ€™s name
*** Not editable
** Pos
*** This will be auto-populated with the Playerâ€™s position from the profile
** From Club
*** This will be auto-populated with the Playerâ€™s Club from the profile
*** Not editable
** To Club
*** There will be a dropdown menu with every Club from every Partner League as an option (excluding the From Club)
* On the modal will be â€œSubmit Transfer Requestâ€� and â€œCancelâ€� buttons
* Once the Transfer is submitted, a Request will appear in the portal of the â€œTo Clubâ€� for them to approve/deny
* User Permissions:
** Club User (Viewer) will not be able to see/select the â€œTransfer Playerâ€� button
** Club Admins will only be able to see/select the â€œTransfer Playerâ€� button for their own Clubs
** BOC/League President will be able to see/select the â€œTransfer Playerâ€� button for all Clubs
*** League Presidents will only be able to see/select the â€œTransfer Playerâ€� button for their own Leagues
